title: Reece Robson
text:
Reece Robson (born 18 June 1998) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>. 
He previously played for the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra Dragons</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a> and at representative level has played for the <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a>.
Background.
Robson was born in <a href="Murwillumbah%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Murwillumbah, New South Wales</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. 
He played junior rugby league for the Murwillumbah Colts and the Bilambil Jets, before moving to <a href="Sydney%2C%20Australia">Sydney</a>. In Sydney, he attended <a href="Endeavour%20Sports%20High%20School">Endeavour Sports High School</a> and played junior rugby league for <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20District%20Rugby%20Football%20League">De La Salle Caringah</a>. In 2016, while attending Endeavour Sports High, he represented the <a href="Australian%20Schoolboys%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Schoolboys</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2014, Robson was a member of the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> <a href="Harold%20Matthews%20Cup">Harold Matthews Cup</a> squad. In 2015, he joined the <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George Dragons</a> <a href="SG%20Ball%20Cup">SG Ball Cup</a> side. In 2016, despite still being SG Ball Cup-eligible, Robson moved up to the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra</a> <a href="NRL%20Under-20s">under-20</a> side, where he played 36 games over two seasons, scoring nine tries. Later that season, he started at hooker for the New South Wales under-18 side. In November 2016, he re-signed with <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra">St. George Illawarra</a> until the end of the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a>. In 2017, he was selected to start at hooker for the New South Wales under-20 and <a href="Junior%20Kangaroos">Junior Kangaroos</a> sides.
2018.
In 2018, Robson joined St. George's <a href="NRL">NRL</a> squad and spent the majority of the season playing for their <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> side, winning their Player of the Year award. He again represented the New South Wales under-20 and <a href="Junior%20Kangaroos">Junior Kangaroos</a> sides in 2018.
In Round 9 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 NRL season</a>, Robson made his debut off the bench in St. George's 34–14 win over Melbourne.
On September 10 at the <a href="Brad%20Fittler">Brad Fittler</a> medal awards, Robson won the award for NSW Under-20 Player of the Year. In October, he represented the <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a> in their win over the <a href="PNG%20Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">PNG Prime Minister's XIII</a>.
2019.
On 6 May, Robson was selected for the <a href="Canterbury%20Cup%20NSW">NSW</a> Residents side that lost to the <a href="Queensland%20Residents%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland Residents</a>. On 12 August, Robson signed a four-year deal with the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>, starting in 2020. 
2020.
In February, Robson was a member of the North Queensland <a href="2020%20NRL%20Nines">2020 NRL Nines</a> winning squad, scoring a try in the final against his former club, the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra Dragons</a>.
In Round 1 of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>, he made his debut for North Queensland in their 21–28 loss to the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>. In Round 3, he scored his first two tries against the <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Titans">Gold Coast Titans</a> in a 36-6 win. In Round 5, Robson became the starting for the North Queensland side. In Round 9, he scored two tries in a 16–42 loss to the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>. On 24 August, Robson was ruled out for the remainer of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a> after tearing his hamstring. In his first season with the North Queensland side, he played 14 games, scoring five tries.
